intro: Hinterhubera nevadensis, commonly known as the Nevada hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Nevada. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
